intro: Tristagma nivale f. nivale, commonly known as the snow tristagma, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
